title:
Should Software - Infrastructure Stock Microsoft Corp (MSFT) Be in Your 
Portfolio Monday?
text:
Microsoft Corp (MSFT) is around the top of the Software - Infrastructure industry according to InvestorsObserver. MSFT received an overall rating of 79, which means that it scores higher than 79 percent of all stocks. Microsoft Corp also achieved a score of 98 in the Software - Infrastructure industry, putting it above 98 percent of Software - Infrastructure stocks. Software - Infrastructure is ranked 29 out of the 148 industries.





 MSFT has an Overall Score of 79. Find out what this means to you and get the rest of the rankings on MSFT!
See Full MSFT Report


What do These Ratings Mean?

Searching for the best stocks to invest in can be difficult. There are thousands of options and it can be confusing on what actually constitutes a great value. InvestorsObserver allows you to choose from eight unique metrics to view the top industries and the best performing stocks in that industry. A score of 79 would rank higher than 79 percent of all stocks.


 

These scores are not only easy to understand, but it is easy to compare stocks to each other. You can find the best stock in an industry, or look for the sector that has the highest average score. The overall score is a combination of technical and fundamental factors that serves as a good starting point when analyzing a stock. Traders and investors with different goals may have different goals and will want to consider other factors than just the headline number before making any investment decisions.

What's Happening With Microsoft Corp Stock Today?
Microsoft Corp (MSFT) stock is trading at $370.80 as of  11:48 AM on Monday, Jan 8, a rise of $3.05, or 0.83% from the previous closing price of $367.75. The stock has traded between  $369.01 and $370.97 so far today. Volume today is low. So far 5,872,613 shares have traded  compared to average volume of 25,517,134 shares.
